resources.string: Coconut is Good to You \nUse it
Note:\n Please select below Message or Mail option to Place the Order

Serving Size : 100gm
 Energy : 723kcal
 Protein : 9gm
 Carbohydrates : 6gm
 Fat : 66 to 70gm
 Natural Sugar : 6gm
 Zero Cholesterol, low in sodium

* 100% organic with zero artificial preservatives.
 * 10-12 fresh matures coconuts make one kg of desiccated coconut. It contains Vitamins, Proteins and Good fat of fresh coconut
 * Shelf life is over six months. For longer shelf life, preserve in dry air tight container
 * Organic desiccated coconut can be used in place of fresh coconut by a simple method of using warm water. You can put warm water with desiccated coconut, let it completely cool before using as replacement for fresh coconut
 * Savor ingredient for chocolates, biscuits bakery and confectionery products

The coconut tree (Cocos nucifera) is a member of the palm tree family (Arecaceae) and the only known living species of the genus Cocos. The term "coconut" (or the archaic "cocoanut") can refer to the whole coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which botanically is a drupe, not a nut. The term is derived from the 16th-century Portuguese and Spanish word coco, meaning "head" or "skull" after the three indentations on the coconut shell that resemble facial featuresCoconuts are known for their versatility of uses, ranging from food to cosmetics. The inner flesh of the mature seed, as well as the coconut milk extracted from it, forms a regular part of the diets of many people in the tropics and subtropics. Coconuts are distinct from other fruits because their endosperm contains a large quantity of clear liquid, called "coconut water" or "coconut juice".

Coconut Laddu is a famous South Indian dessert recipe, made on festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi, Dassehra and Diwali. This coconut recipe is loved by people of all age groups. 
1 cup Desiccated coconut 
1/4 cup water 
1/2 cup sugar 
1/2 teaspoon green cardamom

Coconut Barfi is a famous South Indian dessert recipe, made on festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi, Dassehra and Diwali. This coconut recipe is loved by people of all age groups. 
1 cup desiccated coconut 
1 cup rava 
1 cup milk 
1 cup ghee 
1-1/2 to 2 cups sugar

1) Mix sugar with water and allow it to dissolve. 
2) Keep the sugar solution on low flame and cook for 10 minutes. 
3) The solution will start to thicken and continue to cook till you get the one thread consistency in the sugar solution. 
4) Switch off the flame and add the desiccated coconut and cardamom powder to the sugar solution. 
5) Stir well and let the mixture be just warm and then make small balls from the mixture and serve.
